title: Give Galio a bit of love... and mana
body:
So I've recently been dabbling with Galio and he's an awesome champ to play; great kit, nice bits of damage, so much potential for counter plays, BUT he aint got no MANA. I know he sits under the mage/ tank role, but there are plenty of tanks out there that can cast more than 2 spells without going oom on lvl 2. lvl 3 its worse, coz you gotta wait for your mana to regen before you can cast off the third and potentially a fourth spell. But this leads to you needing incredible timing skills, which are very unforgiving if you dont play it right.

Anyway, the main thing is, you either have to play Galio as a full ap mage, to get the mana regen and pool you require to do the damage. Or go a badass body blocker and hope your teamates can survive with just your q w e combo, coz you aint gunna have enough for that ult.

Food for thought. Also why is he still a 4800 champ?

Bad news is it won't be until next season at the earliest.

I agree 100% though. Love Galio, but I have only played him on the rift a few times. Stopped for a few reasons

1. Mana issues are seriously ridiculous (Missing a Q+E Combo made me want to kms cause it almost always sent me OOM)
2. AD Mids also became insanely popular
3. Grail change. He doesn't benefit from the passive being able to -shield- an ally his W doesn't actually count as a shield. (I understand this, since it doesn't block damage it's more of a buff to defenses but it's still upsetting). Grail was absolutely perfect and core on him before {{item:3070}} 

In the change I really hope they add a small shield to his W. I would 100% main Galio Support then with a Grail + Windspeakers if they did

Still my fave champ to get in ARAM + play in URF though <3

his q offers literally nothing but point and double click damage. His e is meh, low damage and a little movespeed. His passive. most teams dont have enough agic damage to warrant more than 1 magic resist item. His w is unique in the fact it heals when getting hit, but it offers nothing against burst. His ult makes everyone kill him faster

as i said before, his kit isnt bad. Just Rito hasnn't been balancing anything about him, hence his uselessness. there are plenty of other champs in the league with point and click damage abilities, but they've been scaled appropriately, because people play them more often. And not every champ is designed to withstand burst.
And his ult is very useful, but yet again I state, he hasnt been tweaked to withstand the stupid amounts of damage the new champs and popular old champs now do.
So instead of being critically hateful, how about being a bit more optimistic about what a champ could be.
